en: You need to start trusting yourself.
zh: 你需要相信自己了。

en: You are Jerry Grey, you are not a killer. Unless you killed your wife. And the florist.
zh: 你是傑瑞·格雷，你不是兇手，除非真的是你殺死了自己的妻子，還有花店老闆。

en: And, now that you think about it, just how did your cat die six years ago?
zh: 而且現在你也想起來了六年前你的貓是怎麼死的。

en: Today is the WMD plus something, and the day of Sandra’s death plus one.
zh: 今天是搞砸婚禮后的某一天，桑德拉死後的第一天。

en: You spent last night not phoning the police.
zh: 你昨晚並沒有打電話報警。

en: You spent last night sitting on the floor in Sandra’s blood, holding her hand as she got colder and colder.
zh: 你只是坐在地板上，桑德拉的血泊環繞著你。你握著她的手，她的身體越來越涼。

en: Your clothes soaked up her blood, and you had to shower and change earlier because you couldn’t stand it any longer, and when you came back she was exactly where you had left her.
zh: 鮮血浸透了你的衣衫，你再也受不了了，只得去洗澡換衣。回來時，你看到她就躺在你剛剛離去的地方。

en: You were hoping—well, it’s obvious what you were hoping for.
zh: 你希望——好吧，這就是你所希望的。

en: Spending all night watching over Sandra, you thought mostly of how your actions had tainted all the good times you’d had. Your amazing life together, the passion with which you loved her.
zh: 整整一晚上，你守候著桑德拉，滿腦子想著你如何玷污了你們所有的美好時光，你們一生中所有精彩的時刻，你深愛著她的那份感情。

en: You poisoned all of that by taking away her future.
zh: 你剝奪了她的未來，毀掉了所有。

en: You wondered what the future without her would be.
zh: 你不知道沒有她的未來會是什麼樣。

en: And Eva? The news will destroy her.
zh: 還有伊娃呢，這個消息會毀了她。

en: She will never talk to you again.
zh: 她永遠不會和你說話了。

en: You hope her anger towards you doesn’t cloud the way she sees the world, that it doesn’t darken her music.
zh: 你希望她對你的憤怒不會影響她看待世界的方式，不會使她的音樂變得頹廢。

en: And of course you wondered about Hans. About Nurse Mae.
zh: 你對漢斯心存疑慮，對梅護士也心懷疑慮。

en: There are answers you need, but how can you look for them when you don’t even know the right questions?
zh: 你需要答案，但你甚至連怎麼提出正確的問題都不知道了，還怎麼能去質疑他們呢？

en: You need to call the police but not yet.
zh: 你要打電話報警，但暫時還沒有。

en: Aside from holding Sandra’s hand, you’ve also been reading the journal.
zh: 你握著桑德拉的手，閱讀日記。

en: There are things in here you simply can’t remember. Not just things when you were in the off position, like showing up at the old house or at the florist’s, but other things too— like forgetting you had lost the gun, forgetting about asking Doctor Goodstory what else we could do.
zh: 有許多事情你根本不記得，不光是你處於大腦關機狀態時發生的事情，比如為什麼會現身在老房子或花店裡，比如你弄丟了槍，比如問古德斯特里醫生我們還能做些什麼。

en: Before Sandra died, she asked if you had spoken to Hans, and you said no, but you had spoken to him.
zh: 桑德拉遇害之前，她曾問你是否和漢斯說過話，你告訴她說沒有，但你已經和他說過話了。

en: You’d called him the day after the wedding.
zh: 你在婚禮后的第二天打過電話給他。

en: He’d said There’s no point in worrying about something you can’t know about.
zh: 他曾說，擔心你不知道的事情沒有絲毫意義。

en: Worry if you learn more, but until then, just try to act normal.
zh: 等你了解了詳情，那才值得擔憂。但在那之前，就試著一切如常吧。

en: You had even forgotten about Counselor Beverly, who spoke to you about the stages of grief.
zh: 你甚至忘記了心理諮詢師貝弗莉，她跟你說過憂鬱症的幾個階段的問題。

en: You haven’t forgotten the wedding speech.
zh: 但你沒有忘記婚禮上的講話。

en: You still have no memory of the night after you snuck out your window, but the things that didn’t make sense a few entries ago still don’t make any sense now.
zh: 你對你偷偷翻到窗外出去遊盪的那個夜晚已經印象全無，在那之前的幾篇日記中沒有什麼有意義的東西，直到現在也沒有什麼意義。

en: Where did the knife come from?
zh: 刀從何處而來？

en: Did you have blood on your shirt and Nurse Mae missed it, or was Hans mistaken about that?
zh: 你的襯衫上有血跡，是梅護士沒有發現呢，還是漢斯弄錯了？

en: It doesn’t seem like the kind of thing anybody, let alone Hans, would overlook.
zh: 任何人都不可能視而不見，更不用說漢斯了。

en: Either something happened between you walking out the door of Nurse Mae’s house and climbing into Hans’s car, or . . .
zh: 要麼就是在你走出梅護士家門和上漢斯的車之間那段時間發生了什麼事情，要麼就是……

en: Now there are more questions.
zh: 現在，問題還遠不止這些。

en: Why shoot Sandra?
zh: 你為什麼要槍殺桑德拉呢？

en: You don’t remember shooting her, is it possible you didn’t?
zh: 你不記得開槍把她打死，是不是有可能根本就不是你乾的？

en: But you don’t remember spraypainting the bad word across Mrs. Smith’s house, and you obviously did that, so there’s no denying the fact you do things and then forget.
zh: 你不記得用油漆在史密斯太太的房子上噴上污言穢語，但很明顯你這樣做了。所以，是你做了那些事情，只是忘記了，這是無可否認的事實。

en: She sounded so happy, like her life was just beginning.
zh: 她聽起來很快樂，就像她的新生活才剛剛開始。

en: She and Rick are going away on their honeymoon tomorrow and you can’t let them know what’s happened. Not yet.
zh: 她明天要和瑞克去度蜜月了，你不能讓他們知道所發生的一切，至少現在不能。

en: Let them enjoy their week.
zh: 希望他們這一星期玩得開心。

en: It means not calling the police.
zh: 這意味著你不可以報警。

en: You can do that. For Eva.
zh: 你可以這樣做，這是為了伊娃。

en: You’ll call her back tonight and say you’re busy tomorrow, that Sandra is taking you to check out a couple of nursing homes, and to make sure they call when they get to where they’re going.
zh: 你今晚會打電話給她，說你們明天很忙，桑德拉要帶你去看幾所療養院，你讓她等到了他們要去的地方后再打電話過來。

en: Good news—it’s doubtful there will ever be good news again.
zh: 好消息：總會有好消息的。

en: Bad news—Sandra is dead.
zh: 壞消息：桑德拉死了。

en: You can’t fix that in the rewrite.
zh: 再怎麼重寫也無法改變。

en: Eric opens his eyes and there’s a muted sound of coughing that can’t quite make it past the duct tape.
zh: 艾瑞克睜開眼睛，咳嗽了一聲，但因為嘴上粘著膠帶發不出聲音。

en: He looks confused. He squints against the light and twists his head away from the light of the cell phone.
zh: 他一臉茫然，眯著眼睛看了一眼光源，接著扭扭頭避開手機的光亮。

en: Hans punches him in the stomach. Hard. There’s a sharp intake of air through Eric’s nose.
zh: 漢斯一拳打在他的腹部，用力很猛，艾瑞克猛地吸一口氣。

en: Jerry always thought his friend would be capable of something like this, but seeing it happen makes his own stomach clench.
zh: 傑瑞一直知道他的朋友擅長此類事情，但親眼見到還是感到自己的胃一陣陣地緊縮。

en: “Calm down,” Hans says, then gives Eric a small slap.
zh: 漢斯說，輕輕地拍打艾瑞克，「冷靜下來。」

en: “Calm down.”
zh: 「冷靜下來。」

en: Eric can’t calm down, but he manages to stop coughing and he manages to stare at his two captors without struggling. He doesn’t manage to hide the fear in his face.
zh: 艾瑞克冷靜不下來，他想忍住不再咳嗽，不再掙扎，眼睛死死盯著兩個人，毫不掩蓋臉上的恐懼。

en: “You know what we want,” Hans says.
zh: 「你知道我們想要什麼。」漢斯說，「首先我們應該讓你開開眼。」

en: They get Eric to his feet. The orderly tries to struggle, but the duct tape is keeping the fight to a minimum.
zh: 他們讓艾瑞克站了起來，艾瑞克想掙扎，但綁著的膠帶只能將他的掙扎限制在最小幅度之內。

en: They stand him against the window so he can face out, then Jerry realizes Eric probably can’t see much at all. He takes the orderly’s glasses out of his pocket and puts them on Eric’s face.
zh: 他們讓他靠窗站著，面朝窗外，傑瑞想到艾瑞克可能看不清楚，就從他的口袋裡拿出眼鏡，給他戴上。

en: Since you’re bright, you must be able to figure out what’s going to happen if we throw you out the window, which we’re willing to do, unless you tell us about the women.
zh: 正因為你聰明，所以你一定很清楚如果我們把你丟到窗外，你會怎麼樣，我們會這麼做的，除非你告訴我們你是怎麼殺死那些女人的。

en: First some facts. We’re two stories high, and if you survive landing on your head from that height you’re going to wish you hadn’t.
zh: 首先，跟你說下現在的情況：我們在兩層樓高的地方，從這個高度頭朝下著地你還能活嗎？

en: Second, when we take the tape off your mouth, you’re going to have the urge to scream. I would advise against that.
zh: 你知道你不會的；其次，我們會把你嘴上的膠帶撕開，你可能會尖叫，但我建議你不要。

en: Maybe one of them will call the cops, maybe not.
zh: 可能會有人報警，也可能不會。

en: What’s doubtful is somebody rushing over to help you.
zh: 有人會衝過來救你嗎？這一點值得懷疑。

en: What’s doubtful are the cops getting here in the time it takes for you to travel from the window to the patio.
zh: 在你從窗戶掉到院子里的這一會兒工夫里，警察會及時趕到嗎？這一點也值得懷疑。

en: Do you understand what you’re being told?”
zh: 你明白我的意思了嗎？」

en: Eric nods.
zh: 艾瑞克點點頭。

en: They turn him so his back is to the window.
zh: 他們把他轉了個身，所以現在他背對窗外。

en: The whole time his eyes are wide, bugging out of his head is perhaps how Henry would describe it if Henry was in one of his less original moods, Jerry thinks.
zh: 他的眼睛自始至終瞪得大大的。傑瑞心想，要是亨利心情很好，他可能會這樣描述他：他的眼睛瞪得簡直像要從腦袋上爆出來；要是亨利想偷懶，他會這樣描述：他的眼睛瞪得像只茶碟。

en: “We know you killed the girls,” Hans says, and Eric looks confused, or at least is trying to look confused.
zh: 「我們知道你殺了那些女孩。」漢斯說。艾瑞克仍舊一臉茫然，或至少是在裝瘋賣傻。

en: Jerry studies his face, his features, looking for recognition and understanding, but all he sees is fear and uncertainty.
zh: 傑瑞端詳著他的臉，審視著他的表情，想尋找他的認可和理解，但他所看到的只是恐懼和迷茫。

en: Eric, who is shaking his head through the last bit of Hans’s speech, now starts nodding.
zh: 艾瑞克一直在搖頭，聽到漢斯的最後一句話，他拚命地點頭。

en: “I don’t,” he says, and then coughs a little bit more. “I don’t know what you’re talking about.”
zh: 「我不……」他說，咳嗽了一聲，「我不知道你在說什麼。」

en: “Are you sure?”
zh: 「你確定嗎？」

en: Hans asks.
zh: 漢斯問。

en: “I’m positive.”
zh: 「我確定。」

en: “I mean are you sure that’s the way you want to play it?
zh: 「我的意思是你確定你想這樣玩遊戲嗎？

en: We know you set up Jerry here.”
zh: 我們知道你對傑瑞做了手腳。」

en: “You injected me,” Jerry says.
zh: 「你給我注射鎮靜劑。」傑瑞說。

en: “Of course I injected you!
zh: 「當然，我給你打了鎮靜劑！

en: You were getting out of control. We had to calm you down!”
zh: 你失控了，我們得讓你鎮靜下來！」

en: “You’ve injected me more than once,” Jerry says.
zh: 「你不止一次地給我注射鎮靜劑。」傑瑞說。

en: “We often have to inject you.”
zh: 「我們不得不經常給你打鎮靜劑。」

en: “Then how does he escape if he’s been sedated?” Hans asks.
zh: 「那麼，如果你們給他打了鎮靜劑，他怎麼還能溜出去呢？」漢斯問。

en: “I don’t know,” Eric says, his voice breaking a little.
zh: 「我不知道。」艾瑞克說，他的聲音已經嘶啞了，「沒人知道。

en: “Nobody knows. But the days he escapes he’s not sedated, and last night, well, it must have worn off.”
zh: 但他溜出去的那些日子里，沒有打過鎮靜劑，至於昨晚，嗯，一定是藥效減弱了。」

en: “You hear that?”
zh: 「你聽到了嗎？」

en: Hans asks.
zh: 漢斯問。

en: “Hear what?” both Eric and Jerry say at the same time.
zh: 「聽到什麼？」艾瑞克和傑瑞同時說道。

en: “A reason to toss you out the window,” Hans says.
zh: 「一個把你扔出窗外的理由。」漢斯說著，把艾瑞克扭轉過去，讓他再次面向窗外。

en: “But—”

Eric doesn’t get to finish the sentence, because right then Hans punches him in the side of the face, a fast, hard jab that rocks Eric’s head sideways and knocks his glasses off, the hit echoing through the room, bringing an extra layer of reality to a day that has been unbelievable and way too real for Jerry all at the same time. Blood flows from Eric’s nose. Jerry wants to say something, but isn’t sure what.
zh: 艾瑞克沒能把話說完，因為漢斯朝他臉上結結實實地打了一拳，那一拳迅猛有力，艾瑞克的腦袋偏向一邊，眼鏡也掉了，拳擊聲在房間里迴響，讓傑瑞感到恍如夢中。

en: Hans puts the duct tape back over Eric’s mouth then pushes his head through the open window.
zh: 漢斯用膠帶封住艾瑞克的嘴，把他的頭推過開著的窗戶。

en: Eric struggles at first, then relaxes as more of his body is pushed through, a struggle at this point only doing him more harm than good.
zh: 艾瑞克起先拚命掙扎，但隨著身體被逐漸推出窗外，他放鬆下來，此時掙扎沒有半點兒好處，只能給他自己造成更大的傷害。

en: His face bangs against the building as they lower him, his body dragging over the windowsill, bumping and slowing as different body parts grip against it.
zh: 他們推他時，他的臉一直撞向牆壁，他的身體在窗台上拖曳，身體不同部位經過窗檯時不斷摩擦碰撞。此時，他整個上半身都被推了出來。

en: “He’s facing the wrong damn way,” Hans says.
zh: 「媽的，他的方向不對。」漢斯說。

en: “I’m sure he still gets the point,” Jerry says, struggling for breath.
zh: 「我想，他已經明白了。」傑瑞說著，呼哧呼哧喘著粗氣。

en: “We should try and turn him.”
zh: 「我們應該把他轉過來。」

en: “How?”
zh: 「怎麼轉？」

en: “How about—” Hans says, but it’s how about nothing, because Jerry loses his grip on Eric, then with all that extra weight Hans loses his grip too, and then Eric is falling, the distance covered so quickly he reaches the concrete before Jerry is even aware of what’s just happened.
zh: 「這樣——」漢斯說，但用不著考慮怎麼轉了，因為傑瑞失去了對艾瑞克的控制，接著漢斯這邊的重量驟然增加了一倍，他不得不鬆了手，艾瑞克向下落去，還沒等傑瑞弄明白髮生了什麼，他就已經摔在了混凝土地面上。

en: Eric’s sudden fall ended by his sudden stop, and Jerry wonders if this is one more death that will be filed away on his things-to-forget list, whether tomorrow he’ll be denying this to himself, perhaps the same way he’s been denying everything else.
zh: 艾瑞克突然摔了下去，傑瑞已經僵住了，他心想是否應該將艾瑞克之死寫進他的遺忘清單上，明天他是否會否認今天發生的事情，或者，他還會以同樣的方式否認一切。
